description: Pisot sequence E(3,17), a(n) = floor( a(n-1)^2/a(n-2)+1/2 ).
comments: Up to n=10^5, a(n) = 6a(n-1) - 2a(n-2). - _Ralf Stephan_, Sep 03 2013
links: D. W. Boyd, Some integer sequences related to the Pisot sequences, Acta Arithmetica, 34 (1979), 295-305
D. W. Boyd, Linear recurrence relations for some generalized Pisot sequences, Advances in Number Theory ( Kingston ON, 1991) 333-340, Oxford Sci. Publ., Oxford Univ. Press, New York, 1993.
formula: Conjecture: If p[i]=fibonacci(2i+2) and if A is the Hessenberg matrix of order n defined by: A[i,j]=p[j-i+1], (i<=j), A[i,j]=-1, (i=j+1), and A[i,j]=0 otherwise. Then, for n>=1, a(n-1)= det A. [_Milan Janjic_, May 08 2010]
author: _Simon Plouffe_
